title: Harmanpreet Kaur Overtakes MS Dhoni, Becomes First Indian Cricketer To Play In 100 T20Is
text:
India's T20I captain Harmanpreet Kaur achieved an unprecedented feat for an Indian cricketer after reaching a century of T20 international games for the country.

BCCI

After taking the field against South Africa Women in the 6th T20I of the ongoing series, Indian captain created history of her own as she reached the milestone of 100 matches in the shortest format of the game.

Having made her debut in the format in 2009, Harmanpreet has gone on to become one of the best batswoman in the format. She went past MS Dhoni's record of 98 matches.

ICC

Don't Miss

It is also a little surprising given the fact the amount of cricket Indian men's team plays, but it is Harmanpreet Kaur who has scripted her name in the record books.

On the overall list, New Zealand's Suzie Bates, Australian Ellyse Perry and Pakistan's Shoaib Malik lead the pack with 111 T20I appearances each. While Malik is the only man to have featured in 100 T20Is, 10 women (including Kaur) have now played 100 or more shortest-format games for their respective countries.

ICC

The Indian female player closest to her is Mithali Raj, who who retired from T20Is in September, with 89 appearances. Jhulan Goswami with 68 appearances comes next and she had retired in August 2018. Veda Krishnamurthy with 63 appearances is the closest to Harmanpreet among active Indian cricketers.

In November 2018, she became the first woman for India to score a century in a Women's Twenty20 International (WT20I) match.

(With Inputs From IANS)
description: India's T20I captain Harmanpreet Kaur achieved an unprecedented feat for an Indian cricketer after reaching a century of T20 international games for the country. After taking the field against South Africa Women in the 6th T20I of the ongoing series, Indian captain created a history of her own as she reached the milestone of 100 matches in the shortest format of the game.
